hackathon-description-text: ArchHacks is a hackathon hosted at Washington University in St. Louis Nov. 4-6 for 500+ students of all backgrounds with a passion for technology, design, and, most importantly, building things. ArchHacks brings together  We will provide a unique opportunity for students to work with resources and companies they cannot find anywhere else, and our theme, HealthTech, means that the products our participants create will make a real difference. You will have the opportunity to make invaluable connections with corporations, collaborate with friends and, most importantly, develop something that will contribute to the HealthTech community.

hackathon-judges.judge-name: Prizes will be judged by a team from the sponsoring company

hackathon-eligibility:
Must be over 18 by Nov 4, 2016
Must be an enrolled student. Contact us at
Teams can be up to 4 students.
hackathon-rules:
Hacks must be started after Nov 4, 2016 at 5pm. 
All participants must be 18 years of age or older on Nov 4, 2016.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: MacBook Pro 13-inch with Retina Display for each winning member
Each member of the winning team will receive an Oculus Rift
Each team member will receive $1,000 and an Apple Watch
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Hack Addressing Socioeconomic Health Disparities - Centene

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Each member of the winning team will receive an awesome quadcopter drone
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Hack for an Aging Population - Lumeris

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Win a set of books hand selected by the founding team of StaffJoy!
Each member of the winning team will receive $100 gift card, 1 Raspberry Pi 3 kit, 1 Year of Wolfram|Alpha Pro and 1 Year Wolfram Development Platform
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Effective Use of Wolfram Technologies

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Each member of the winning team will receive a Crazyflie 2.0 drone courtesy of Siemens!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: 1st Place - Best Hardware Hack by Siemens

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Each member of the 2nd place team will receive an Arduino Basic Kit courtesy of Siemens! The kit includes more than 150 components and an Arduino UNO.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: 2nd Place - Best Hardware Hack by Siemens

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Panera gift card and swag bag!
Each winning team member will receive an iPad mini, a FitBit, and a GoPro!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Data-Driven App Using Cisco Spark/Tropo

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Everything is part of the internet of things now - from your phone to your fitness band to your thermostat. Build a hack that utilizes private data being collected from your devices, and show how you can turn potential vulnerabilities into something constructive. Prize: Collector's Edition of Watch Dogs 2
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Watch Dogs® 2 Best Device Privacy Hack

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment. Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Win HackHarassment Swag Bag.
$500.00 Amazon gift card for each winning team member
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Health Communications Hack by RedCard

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The winning team will win a $300 Microsoft gift card!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Mental Health Hack by BJC

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The winning team must consist of students from at least 2 different universities. Each member of the winning team will receive a tote bag sponsor by True Ventures including a Fitbit Charge 2!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Hack from an Inter-Collegiate Team

hackathon-description-header: 500+ students building around the theme of HealthTech
hackathon-location-description: Bauer Hall at Washington University in St. Louis
